lines.text: Now, here is the story of the noble dog, who saved the king from the wicked wizard. Once upon a time...
Oh, mother, please. Are there any stories about... about little people?
Well, as a matter of fact, there are, Thumbelina. Look.
[lifts her on to the book, which is opened to a picture of fairies]
Why, they are little! Just like me!
Those are wings, Thumbelina. These are fairies and fairies have wings so they can fly.
Mother, have you ever seen a fairy?
Well, I thought I did once.
[puts reading glass on to picture to magnify the image]
And here, the fairy prince and princess are having a wedding.
And they live... happily ever after!

[crawls under glasses so she is by the picture of the prince]
I... suppose it works best if two people are about... the same size.

[crawls out from underneath the glasses]
Well... well, that's not fair. I... I must be the only little person in the world. I wish I were big.
Oh, no, Thumbelina. No. Don't ever wish to be anything but what you are.

[singing]
You will be my wings/You will be my only love/You will take me far beyond the stars
Jacquimo, this is silly! This is a weed patch!
This is ze Vale of ze Fairies!
You will lift me high above/Everything we're dreaming of will soon be ours/Anything that we desire/Anything at all/Everyday you'll take me higher...
Let's be practical. This isn't the Vale of the Fairies, and Cornelius is never coming back!

[comes up behind her, singing]
And I'll never let you fall!
Hello. Welcome to Paris, city of love. Who am I? I am Jacquimo, swallow extraordinaire and lover of beautiful things.
[Jacquimo flies through the sky above the pond as he hums]

[turns around]
Whoa! Help? Who is saying "help"?
Oh! Oh, little one, are you having a bad day?
Oh, I was... I was sleeping on the windowsill, waiting for Prince Cornelius to come back, and... he said he would come before morning because he loves me and...
Thanks. But, well... but I was stolen away by Mrs. Toad, who says I have to marry her son, and I just...
A toad? Ptooey toad! Zat is a very bad day, Mademoiselle... uh, Mademoiselle...?
Thumbelina, I am Jacquimo. How can I be of service to you?
Well, I must get off this lily pad, but... that's impossible.
Oh! Oh, no, Hero. See? He's nice.
How do you do, sir? Thank you... thank you for... coming to visit.
Well, that's a funny name! Oh! I mean, I mean it's perfect.

[not knowing that Cornelius is the prince]
Tell me about the fairy court. Is there a prince?
I'd love to meet the prince.
Don't look now, dear husband, but our son is missing *again*.

[looks]
So he is. I think he feels a bit silly riding that white butterfly we gave him.
Weel, why should he feel silly?
It dosn't make the right impression on the young ladies.
Well, what of the impression on the *court*! Colbert, my love, it is the Autumn *today*. And we have begun the golding of the leaves. He *should* be here!
He'll hurt himself. I just hope he's not buzzing through the vales on that wretched bumblebee. He is the crown prince, for Heaven's sake!

[laughing]
Tabitha dear, have you forgotten what it's like to be 16?
[just as they pass over, Cornelius speeds out from under the undergrowth]
Oh! Hello. What a beautiful voice!
Stay here, boy. I'll check this out.
Well, I'm afraid you'll just have to wait here 'till spring, Thumbelina.

[jumps to her feet]
You know my name!
Oh, that was easy! I know much more, like you *were* engaged to the fairy prince, erm... Cornelius, I believe...
That he was found, stone-cold-frozen *DEAD*, in the snow.

[flippantly]
But of course, you knew that!
[after performing with Mrs. Toad and her sons and receiving a standing ovation]
Oh thank you, Mrs. Toad, thank you! They really like me! Am I a star?
Yes. And you can call me Mama.
You are going to marry my son Grundel.

[Grundel sulks, dipping his fingers in the water. Mozo appears and speaks in a teasing tone]
Hey bro...
Pond Doc has said Thumbelina give you the slip, and is going to marry a fairy prince.
Ho ho ho! You'll not be able to show your ugly face on the stage no more.
I go get Thumbelina and bring her back!
[They laugh uncontrollably, and an enraged Grundel throws them up in the air]
[He storms off, leaving Mozo and Gringo laughing their heads off]

[to Thumbelina after the Beetle Ball]
Don't worry, you'll get over me.
